bgcolor.center: Here's to a new adventure - Online Learning starting Monday, March 30!

h3.a: Schools still benefit from Box Tops

div.p: Dear Families, The Box Tops for Education program is changing the way we can earn cash for our school! Over the summer, participating brands have begun to change their packaging from the traditional Box Tops clip to the new Box Tops label.

Going forward, instead of clipping from packages and checking expiration dates, all Box Tops will be earned digitally by scanning your receipt. The Box Tops for Education team has worked hard to build a NEW-and-improved, user-friendly Box Tops mobile app, available now. The new app features state-of-the-art technology that allows you to scan your store receipt, find participating products and instantly add Box Tops to our school's earnings online.
BE SURE TO DOWNLOAD THE NEW APP OR UPDATE YOUR EXISTING APP.Â

If you still have traditional Box Tops clips at home, make sure to send them to school. We will still earn cash for all clipped Box Tops until they expire. Better yet, you can âdouble dipâ during the packaging transition by clipping traditional Box Tops AND scanning your store receipt containing participating products. Thanks for helping our school get what it needs!
LEARN MORE ABOUT THESE CHANGES AT BTFE.COM.

a.aria-label: Read more about Schools still benefit from Box Tops

p.img: The regular Spring Book Fair at Logan District #326 has been cancelled.Â Anyone who still wants to take advantage of the Book Fair for Logan can shop online beginning March 26th and ending April 8th, 2020.

div.p: This is the link to the Online Book Fair homepage for Logan.Â Shoppers can click on this link to buy books directly from The Scholastic Store.Â There are deep discounts on allÂ sale items, plus anÂ extra 15% off when you use the codeÂ BOOKBUZ.Â Â All orders ship directly to home.Â Scroll down to the online fair section where you see a shopping cart.Â Click on the cart and happy shopping!

h3.a: Logan USD 326 to offer free meals

img.style: float: right; width: 300px; height: 285px; margin-left: 10px; margin-right: 10px;

span.em: The Kansas State Department of Education's Child Nutrition and Wellness team andÂ Logan school district are teaming up to keep Kansas children fed.

div.p: FREE MEALS for children ages 1-18 will be provided at the following times and locations beginning Monday, March 30, 2020 through the last day of regularly scheduled school.

p.strong: MEALS are Grab 'n Go - Walk or Drive - Curbside Pick Up - Children Must Be Present

div.p: Monday, Wednesday, Friday 11:30-12:30 - Monday & Wednesday - 2 lunches and 2 breakfasts will be provided; Friday - 1 lunch and 1 breakfast will be provided.
Logan High School
Prairie View Community Center

p.strong: Each location will provide meals for all children ages 1-18; children must be present to pick up meals.Â Â

div.p: Â

div.p: This notice is to communicate the times and procedures for students/parents to come to the school building to get their belongings and school supplies needed for the next 6 1â2 weeks of school.Â If the times listed below canât work for you, please call either office at school and schedule a time.Â Keep in mind that the fewer people you bring along to retrieve things, the better as we must adhere to the 10 people rule. Please start at Jessâs office and she will give you a check out sheet, check you in the building and keep track of our numbers. Continuous education will begin on Monday, March 30.Â Thank you very much for your help and cooperation with everything that lies ahead!
PreK â 4th grade The individual teachers will be in contact with parents to set up the time for you to come in.
5th â 12th grade We will be at the school for check out on Tuesday and Wednesday March 24th and 25th.

a.aria-label: Read more about Check out Procedure

h3.a: Important information for schools regarding the coronavirus

div.p: Â

span.b: Today, March 17, 2020 Governor Laura Kelly announced all school facilities will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. This will place tremendous hardship on our families and staff, and impact the social and emotional well-being of our students.
We have been working on contingency plans since mid-March, including how we can meet the ongoing learning needs of our students and provide breakfast and lunch for our students.

Staff will plan next week in preparation for continuous learning which includes face to face with groups less than ten, on-line, and packet learning.Â This will not be traditional school. There will be grab and go breakfast and lunch available beginning March 30 as continuous learning begins that day.Â We will have plans in place by March 27.

Our staff and board of education are also working on other critical issues, such as what this means for our seniors, how this will affect next school year and what impact this will have on our employees. We will provide updates on these issues as soon as the information is available.

We are committed to working together as a community to support one another throughout these unprecedented times, and communication will remain a top priority.Â Information will be shared via Facebook, Twitter, text alert, and KKAN/KQMA.
As a reminder, this school closure is in response to the current public health crisis. The focus should remain on preventing the spread the coronavirus, or COVID-19 as it is also referred to.
Please be mindful of the following:
Wash your hands frequently with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.
Cover your nose and mouth when coughing and sneezing (cough/sneeze into your sleeve or a tissue).
Please keep sick children at home.
Avoid close contact with anyone with cold or flu-like symptoms.
Follow additional guidance from these sources:
Kansas Department of Health and Environment (KDHE)â¯

a.aria-label: Read more about Important information for schools regarding the coronavirus

h3.a: Please donate your unused books to the ABC Daycare!

div.p: It's time for Spring Cleaning!Â If you have any new or used books lying around that you do not want, please consider donating them to the ABC Daycare.Â The Logan KAY organization will donate $1 for every book received (up to $300) in the month of March!Â You can drop off the books in the Elementary office or give to a KAY member.Â Thank you for supporting our young children!

h5.a: Lady Trojans end basketball season with loss to Osborne

div.p: The Logan Trojans played in the Regional Tournament this week.Â On the girls side, the Lady Trojans hosted Rock Hills on Tuesday, Feb. 25 where they won easily with a scoreÂ 45-30.Â Junior Khloee Braun dominated in the paint score a career high of 21 points.Â TheÂ girls then traveled to Mankato for the second round of tournament action where they played Osborne.Â Both teams played tough and the score was tied at 32 at halftime.Â The hot-shooting Bulldogs came out in the thirdÂ quarter and put up 20 points compared to just 6 for the Trojans.Â . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Lady Trojans end basketball season with loss to Osborne

div.p: In their first of four trips to Mankato, the Logan Trojans began their Regional play on Monday, Feb. 24 as they played Rock Hills and won with a score of 66-43.Â Sophomore Dylan Van Laeys put up aÂ double-double with 20 points and 11 rebounds, followed by Ty Kats with 15 points and 4 steals.Â The Trojans returned to Mankato on Thursday, seeded againstÂ the #1 ranked Osborne Bulldogs.Â The game looked bleak for the Trojans in the first quarter when the Bulldogs jumped to an early 11-2 lead, but the Trojans came back and were up 15-13 by the end of the first . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Logan boys headed to Sub-State!!

h5.a: LHS Scholars Bowl Team Competes at League

div.p:
Â
On Wednesday, January 22, the LHS Scholars Bowl team competed at the League Meet at Ransom.Â Team members Zachary Jansonius, Jed Peace, Ian Sparks, Khloee Braun, and Dylan Van Laeys competed against the other eleven teams in the WKLL.Â The Trojans lost a tie break to eventual champions, Golden Plains, and had several other close matches. They finished the meet 6-5 which put them into 6th place.Â Wheatland/Grinnell finished 2nd, and Western Plains took 3rd.Â The Trojans worked really well as a team and each team member made a significant contribution to . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about LHS Scholars Bowl Team Competes at League

h5.a: Logan Trojans play hard against their rival

div.p:
The Junior Trojans stayed home on Thursday, Jan. 16 to host the Huskies from Northern Valley.Â On the girls side, after a loss in the B-team game 8-14, the A-team Trojans were ready to play.Â They played lights out in the first half with hustle and confidence and hit almost everything they shot.Â They held on in the second half and won 32-20, avenging their loss to the Huskies earlier in the season.Â
With a score of 4-4 in the final 2 minutes of the C-team boys game, Kaden Coleman and Carson Knipp capitalized on the Logan press causing several turnovers which . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Logan Trojans play hard against their rival

h5.a: Logan Trojans take on Western Plains/Healy

div.p:
Â
On Monday, Jan. 13, the Junior Trojans traveled to Bazine.Â The B-teams played Western Plains/Healy and the A-teams played Sacred Heart from Ness City.
B-team vs Western Plains/Healy Logan girls lost 13-22 Logan boys lost 8-29
A-team vs Sacred Heart from Ness City Logan girls won 32-20 Logan boys won 47-26
